channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: NYTのゲーム部門責任者ジョナサン・ナイト氏へのインタビュー。同紙の新しいゲーム・コネクション、読者のための「ニュース＋ゲーム」の日課作りなどについて（Sarah Scire/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Sarah Scire / Nieman Lab:
An interview with Jonathan Knight, head of games at the NYT, on the paper's new game Connections, creating a “news plus games” daily habit for readers, and more  —  “Come for the news, stay for the games.”  —  Jonathan Knight, head of games for The New York Times, has a few rules for new games.

item.title: 任天堂オブアメリカのダグ・バウザー社長は、ゲーム会社からライブイベントを含むより広範なエンターテインメント企業への進化について語る（Gene Park/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Gene Park / Washington Post:
Doug Bowser, president of Nintendo of America, describes the company's evolution from a gaming company to a broader entertainment company, including live events  —  For decades, Nintendo was synonymous with video games.  Now in its second century, the Japanese company wants to be much more.

item.title: AIを使ってドレイクやザ・ウィークエンドのモノマネをした匿名クリエイター、ゴーストライターがレコード会社やグラミー賞主催者らと会談し、新曲を発表（Joe Coscarelli/New York Times）
item.description:
Joe Coscarelli / New York Times:
Ghostwriter, the anonymous creator who used AI to mimic Drake and The Weeknd, has met with record labels, Grammy organizers, and more, and releases a new song  —  The anonymous artist, who stirred conversation with the A.I. track “Heart on My Sleeve,” has been quietly consulting with executives, while also gunning for a Grammy.

item.title: ロッテン・トマトの "トマトメーター "は、エンターテインメントにおける重要な指標であるが、一部のPR会社が無名の "批評家 "に報酬を支払うことでそのスコアをハックすることで、いかに不安定で還元的なものになったか（Lane Brown/Vulture）
item.description:
Lane Brown / Vulture:
How Rotten Tomatoes' Tomatometer, an important metric in entertainment, became erratic and reductive as some PR firms hack its score by paying obscure “critics”  —  In 2018, a movie-publicity company called Bunker 15 took on a new project: Ophelia, a feminist retelling of Hamlet starring Daisy Ridley.
